title: Star Manager’s Flagship Fund to Close After Suspension
text:
The flagship £2.9 billion fund of one of the U.K.’s best known money managers will be liquidated after it failed to recover from a wave of investor redemptions earlier this year, demonstrating the difficulty of fixing portfolios that become over exposed to illiquid assets.

Neil Woodford, who built his star reputation over more than two decades running money for U.K.-listed Invesco, has been trying to reduce the Woodford Equity Income Fund’s exposure to unlisted and rarely-traded equities for months since a sudden demand for...
description: The flagship £2.9 billion fund of one of the U.K.’s best known money managers will be liquidated after it failed to recover from a wave of investor redemptions earlier this year, demonstrating the difficulty of fixing portfolios that become over exposed to illiquid assets.
